alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 12:46AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern McCurtain County through 115 AM CST... At 1246 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles north of Broken Bow, or 22 miles northwest of De Queen, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Broken Bow, Hochatown and Plunketville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CST for southwestern Arkansas.
